eyetrack_stim_inten[source]

eyetrack_stim_inten(stim_inten, eye_track, upsampling=2, eye_calib=[[94, 8], [18, 59]], box_w=None, box_h=None, stim_axis='x')

From stimulus data and eye tracking, returns a corrected and upsampled stimulus data.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

saccade_distances[source]

saccade_distances(eye_position)

Create a mask for the eye position timeserie that indicate how far was the last saccade. The eye positions need to be smoothed with smooth_eye_position

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

process_sta_batch[source]

process_sta_batch(stim_inten, spike_counts, Hw=30, Fw=2, return_pval=False)

Calculate the STA for a batch of cells.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

staEst_fromBins[source]

staEst_fromBins(stim, spike_counts, Hw, Fw=0)

Fw is the amount of frame after a spike that we calculate the average for. stim must be of shape (xy,n_frame) spike_counts must be of shape (n_frame, n_cells) Return sta of all cells in the shape (n_cells, Hw+Fw, yx)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cross_correlation[source]

cross_correlation(spike_counts, tail_len=50)

From spike_counts of shape (n_dpoints, n_cell), calculate the cross correlation of the cells over a window of tail_len*2 centered on the middle of the trace.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

direction_selectivity[source]

direction_selectivity(grouped_spikes_d)

Compute the direction selectivity index of cells in the given dict containing for each condition as the keys, an array of shape (n_angle, n_repeat, trial_len, n_cell). Such dictionnary can be obtained by using utils.group_direction_response Return a dictionnary containing for each condition a tuple:

- spike_sum: a sum of the spikes for each angle for each cell
- dir_pref : an imaginary number of the prefered direction for each cell
- the direction selectivity index of each cell
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
